013package org.apache.juneau.junit.bct;
014
015import static java.lang.Integer.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.junit.bct.Utils.*;
017
018import java.lang.reflect.*;
019import java.util.*;
020
021/**
022 * Collection of standard property extractor implementations for the Bean-Centric Testing framework.
023 *
024 * <p>This class provides the built-in property extraction strategies that handle the most common
025 * object types and property access patterns. These extractors are automatically registered when
026 * using {@link BasicBeanConverter.Builder#defaultSettings()}.</p>
027 *
028 * <h5 class='section'>Extractor Hierarchy:</h5>
029 * <p>The extractors form an inheritance hierarchy for code reuse:</p>
030 * <ul>
031 *    <li><b>{@link ObjectPropertyExtractor}</b> - Base class with JavaBean property access</li>
032 *    <li><b>{@link ListPropertyExtractor}</b> - Extends ObjectPropertyExtractor with array/collection support</li>
033 *    <li><b>{@link MapPropertyExtractor}</b> - Extends ObjectPropertyExtractor with Map key access</li>
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * <h5 class='section'>Execution Order:</h5>
037 * <p>In {@link BasicBeanConverter}, the extractors are tried in this order:</p>
038 * <ol>
039 *    <li><b>Custom extractors</b> - User-registered extractors via {@link BasicBeanConverter.Builder#addPropertyExtractor(PropertyExtractor)}</li>
040 *    <li><b>{@link ObjectPropertyExtractor}</b> - JavaBean properties, fields, and methods</li>
041 *    <li><b>{@link ListPropertyExtractor}</b> - Array/collection indices and size properties</li>
042 *    <li><b>{@link MapPropertyExtractor}</b> - Map key access and size property</li>
043 * </ol>
044 *
045 * <h5 class='section'>Property Access Strategy:</h5>
046 * <p>Each extractor implements a comprehensive fallback strategy for maximum compatibility:</p>
047 *
048 * @see PropertyExtractor
049 * @see BasicBeanConverter.Builder#defaultSettings()
050 * @see BasicBeanConverter.Builder#addPropertyExtractor(PropertyExtractor)
051 */
052public class PropertyExtractors {
053
054   private PropertyExtractors() {}
055
056   /**
057    * Standard JavaBean property extractor using reflection.
058    *
059    * <p>This extractor serves as the universal fallback for property access, implementing
060    * comprehensive JavaBean property access patterns. It tries multiple approaches to
061    * access object properties, providing maximum compatibility with different coding styles.</p>
062    *
063    * <h5 class='section'>Property Access Order:</h5>
064    * <ol>
065    *    <li><b>{@code is{Property}()}</b> - Boolean property getters (e.g., {@code isActive()})</li>
066    *    <li><b>{@code get{Property}()}</b> - Standard getter methods (e.g., {@code getName()})</li>
067    *    <li><b>{@code get(String)}</b> - Map-style property access with property name as parameter</li>
068    *    <li><b>Fields</b> - Public fields with matching names (searches inheritance hierarchy)</li>
069    *    <li><b>{@code {property}()}</b> - No-argument methods with exact property name</li>
070    * </ol>
071    *
072    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
073    * <p class='bjava'>
074    *    <jc>// Property "name" can be accessed via:</jc>
075    *    <jv>obj</jv>.getName()        <jc>// Standard getter</jc>
076    *    <jv>obj</jv>.name             <jc>// Public field</jc>
077    *    <jv>obj</jv>.name()           <jc>// Method with property name</jc>
078    *    <jv>obj</jv>.get(<js>"name"</js>)       <jc>// Map-style getter</jc>
079    *
080    *    <jc>// Property "active" (boolean) can be accessed via:</jc>
081    *    <jv>obj</jv>.isActive()       <jc>// Boolean getter</jc>
082    *    <jv>obj</jv>.getActive()      <jc>// Standard getter alternative</jc>
083    *    <jv>obj</jv>.active           <jc>// Public field</jc>
084    * </p>
085    *
086    * <p><b>Compatibility:</b> This extractor can handle any object type, making it the
087    * universal fallback. It always returns {@code true} from {@link #canExtract(BeanConverter, Object, String)}.</p>
088    */
089   public static class ObjectPropertyExtractor implements PropertyExtractor {
090
091      @Override
092      public boolean canExtract(BeanConverter converter, Object o, String name) {
093         return true;
094      }
095
096      @Override
097      public Object extract(BeanConverter converter, Object o, String name) {
098         return
099            safe(() -> {
100               if (o == null)
101                  return null;
102               var f = (Field)null;
103               var c = o.getClass();
104               var n = Character.toUpperCase(name.charAt(0)) + name.substring(1);
105               var m = Arrays.stream(c.getMethods()).filter(x -> x.getName().equals("is"+n) && x.getParameterCount() == 0).findFirst().orElse(null);
106               if (m != null) {
107                  m.setAccessible(true);
108                  return m.invoke(o);
109               }
110               if (o instanceof Map.Entry<?,?> me) {
111                  // Reflection to classes inside java.util are restricted in Java 9+.
112                  if ("key".equals(name)) return me.getKey();
113                  if ("value".equals(name)) return me.getValue();
114               }
115               m = Arrays.stream(c.getMethods()).filter(x -> x.getName().equals("get"+n) && x.getParameterCount() == 0).findFirst().orElse(null);
116               if (m != null) {
117                  m.setAccessible(true);
118                  return m.invoke(o);
119               }
120               m = Arrays.stream(c.getMethods()).filter(x -> x.getName().equals("get") && x.getParameterCount() == 1 && x.getParameterTypes()[0] == String.class).findFirst().orElse(null);
121               if (m != null) {
122                  m.setAccessible(true);
123                  return m.invoke(o, name);
124               }
125               var c2 = c;
126               while (f == null && c2 != null) {
127                  f = Arrays.stream(c2.getDeclaredFields()).filter(x -> x.getName().equals(name)).findFirst().orElse(null);
128                  c2 = c2.getSuperclass();
129               }
130               if (f != null) {
131                  f.setAccessible(true);
132                  return f.get(o);
133               }
134               m = Arrays.stream(c.getMethods()).filter(x -> x.getName().equals(name) && x.getParameterCount() == 0).findFirst().orElse(null);
135               if (m != null) {
136                  m.setAccessible(true);
137                  return m.invoke(o);
138               }
139               throw new PropertyNotFoundException(name, o.getClass());
140            });
141      }
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * Property extractor for array and collection objects with numeric indexing and size access.
146    *
147    * <p>This extractor extends {@link ObjectPropertyExtractor} to add special handling for
148    * collection-like objects. It provides array-style access using numeric indices and
149    * universal size/length properties for any listifiable object.</p>
150    *
151    * <h5 class='section'>Additional Properties:</h5>
152    * <ul>
153    *    <li><b>Numeric indices:</b> <js>"0"</js>, <js>"1"</js>, <js>"2"</js>, etc. for element access</li>
154    *    <li><b>Negative indices:</b> <js>"-1"</js>, <js>"-2"</js> for reverse indexing (from end)</li>
155    *    <li><b>Size properties:</b> <js>"length"</js> and <js>"size"</js> return collection size</li>
156    * </ul>
157    *
158    * <h5 class='section'>Supported Types:</h5>
159    * <p>Works with any object that can be listified by the converter:</p>
160    * <ul>
161    *    <li><b>Arrays:</b> All array types (primitive and object)</li>
162    *    <li><b>Collections:</b> List, Set, Queue, and all Collection subtypes</li>
163    *    <li><b>Iterables:</b> Any object implementing Iterable</li>
164    *    <li><b>Streams:</b> Stream objects and other lazy sequences</li>
165    *    <li><b>Maps:</b> Converted to list of entries for iteration</li>
166    * </ul>
167    *
168    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
169    * <p class='bjava'>
170    *    <jc>// Array/List access</jc>
171    *    <jv>list</jv>.get(0)          <jc>// "0" property</jc>
172    *    <jv>array</jv>[2]             <jc>// "2" property</jc>
173    *    <jv>list</jv>.get(-1)         <jc>// "-1" property (last element)</jc>
174    *
175    *    <jc>// Size access</jc>
176    *    <jv>array</jv>.length         <jc>// "length" property</jc>
177    *    <jv>collection</jv>.size()    <jc>// "size" property</jc>
178    *    <jv>stream</jv>.count()       <jc>// "length" or "size" property</jc>
179    * </p>
180    *
181    * <p><b>Fallback:</b> If the property is not a numeric index or size property,
182    * delegates to {@link ObjectPropertyExtractor} for standard property access.</p>
183    */
184   public static class ListPropertyExtractor extends ObjectPropertyExtractor {
185
186      @Override
187      public boolean canExtract(BeanConverter converter, Object o, String name) {
188         return converter.canListify(o);
189      }
190
191      @Override
192      public Object extract(BeanConverter converter, Object o, String name) {
193         var l = converter.listify(o);
194         if (name.matches("-?\\d+")) {
195            var index = parseInt(name);
196            if (index < 0) {
197               index = l.size() + index; // Convert negative index to positive
198            }
199            return l.get(index);
200         }
201         if ("length".equals(name)) return l.size();
202         if ("size".equals(name)) return l.size();
203         return super.extract(converter, o, name);
204      }
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Property extractor for Map objects with direct key access and size property.
209    *
210    * <p>This extractor extends {@link ObjectPropertyExtractor} to add special handling for
211    * Map objects. It provides direct key-based property access and a universal size
212    * property for Map objects.</p>
213    *
214    * <h5 class='section'>Map-Specific Properties:</h5>
215    * <ul>
216    *    <li><b>Direct key access:</b> Any property name that exists as a Map key</li>
217    *    <li><b>Size property:</b> {@code "size"} returns {@code map.size()}</li>
218    * </ul>
219    *
220    * <h5 class='section'>Supported Types:</h5>
221    * <p>Works with any object implementing the {@code Map} interface:</p>
222    * <ul>
223    *    <li><b>HashMap, LinkedHashMap:</b> Standard Map implementations</li>
224    *    <li><b>TreeMap, ConcurrentHashMap:</b> Specialized Map implementations</li>
225    *    <li><b>Properties:</b> Java Properties objects</li>
226    *    <li><b>Custom Maps:</b> Any Map implementation</li>
227    * </ul>
228    *
229    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
230    * <p class='bjava'>
231    *    <jc>// Direct key access</jc>
232    *    <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"name"</js>)       <jc>// "name" property</jc>
233    *    <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"timeout"</js>)    <jc>// "timeout" property</jc>
234    *    <jv>props</jv>.getProperty(<js>"key"</js>) <jc>// "key" property</jc>
235    *
236    *    <jc>// Size access</jc>
237    *    <jv>map</jv>.size()           <jc>// "size" property</jc>
238    * </p>
239    *
240    * <h5 class='section'>Key Priority:</h5>
241    * <p>Map key access takes priority over JavaBean properties. If a Map contains
242    * a key with the same name as a property/method, the Map value is returned first.</p>
243    *
244    * <p><b>Fallback:</b> If the property is not found as a Map key and is not "size",
245    * delegates to {@link ObjectPropertyExtractor} for standard property access.</p>
246    */
247   public static class MapPropertyExtractor extends ObjectPropertyExtractor {
248
249      @Override
250      public boolean canExtract(BeanConverter converter, Object o, String name) {
251         return o instanceof Map;
252      }
253
254      @Override
255      public Object extract(BeanConverter converter, Object o, String name) {
256         var m = (Map<?,?>)o;
257         if (eq(name, converter.getSetting(BasicBeanConverter.SETTING_nullValue, "<null>"))) name = null;
258         if (m.containsKey(name)) return m.get(name);
259         if ("size".equals(name)) return m.size();
260         return super.extract(converter, o, name);
261      }
262   }
263}
